conclusion: Given refractive index n = 2, radius R, length L, light enters vertically and exits through curved surface.
Angle of incidence is 90 degrees; using Snell's law, angle of refraction Î¸2 is 30 degrees.
Height of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is equal to radius R.
Area S of the part of the cylindrical surface is calculated as S = R * L.
Final answer: Area S = R * L.
